org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.schewe
Class HistoryTree

java.lang.Object
  org.svvrl.goal.core.comp.schewe.HistoryTree
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable
public class HistoryTree
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable

This class implements the history tree with labels and LIR in [Sven Schewe: Tighter Bounds for the Determinisation of BÃ¼chi Automata. FOSSACS 2009: 167-181 (2009)]. If LIR is needed, setLIREnabled(boolean) should be called right after a history tree is created.

Author:
Ming-Hsien Tsai

public java.util.List<Node> getLIR()

getParity

public int getParity()
Returns the parity of this tree. The returned parity is valid only if LIR is enabled.

getNode

public Node getNode(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> path)
Returns the end node of a specified path in this tree.

Parameters:
path - a path in this tree
Returns:
the end node of the path in this tree, null if there is no such path

removeNode

public java.util.Set<Node> removeNode(Node node)
Removes a node and all its descendants from this tree recursively. Note that the root node of this tree is never removed.

Parameters:
node - the node to be removed from this tree
Returns:
all nodes removed

reset

public void reset()
Reset accepting and unstable nodes.

move

public void move(java.lang.String symbol)
Moves the states in this tree one-step forward with respect to a symbol. This method corresponds to the first part of the first step in the paper.

Parameters:
symbol - a symbol in the alphabet to be consumed

spawn

public void spawn()
Generates children for all tree nodes. This method corresponds to the second part of the first step in the paper. If LIR is enabled, new nodes will be inserted to the LIR.

merge

public void merge()
Removes a state from a node if the state is contained in some older sibling of the node. This method corresponds to the second step in the paper.

shrink

public void shrink()
Removes all empty nodes, and removes all children of a node if its label is equal to the union of the labels of its children. The accepting states will be updated. This method corresponds to the third step in the paper. If LIR is enabled, the removed nodes in the LIR will be replaced by dummy nodes.

reorder

public void reorder()
Makes this tree an order closed tree. The unstable states will be updated. A node will be removed from the accepting nodes if it is found to be unstable. This method corresponds to the fourth step in the paper. If LIR is enabled, the dummy nodes in the LIR will be removed and the parity of this tree will be updated.

getAcceptingNodes

public java.util.Collection<Node> getAcceptingNodes()
Returns the accepting nodes in this tree.

Returns:
the accepting nodes in this tree

Returns true if a node is accepting in this tree.

Parameters:
node - a node in this tree
Returns:
true if the node is accepting in this tree

public java.util.Collection<Node> getUnstableNodes()
Returns all derived unstable nodes.

Returns:
all derived unstable nodes

isUnstable

public boolean isUnstable(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> path)
Returns true if the end node of a specified path is unstable.

Parameters:
path - a path in this tree
Returns:
true if the end node of the path is unstable or there is no such path
